intro: Euphrasia diversifolia, commonly known as the variable eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia diversifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
